title.native: たとえばラストダンジョン前の村の少年が序盤の街で暮らすような物語
title.romaji: Tatoeba Last Dungeon Mae no Mura no Shounen ga Joban no Machi de Kurasu Youna Monogatari
title.english: Suppose a Kid from the Last Dungeon Boonies moved to a starter town?

description:
The story follows Lloyd, a budding adventurer who just wants to get stronger. His plan? Head to the capital and discover his true power, even though he grew up being considered a weakling. So Lloyd heads out from his hometown, which interestingly exists directly next to the most dangerous dungeon. He might not think of himself as strong, but he’ll soon learn that there’s even more of a difference between him and other starting adventurers.

You know, because he grew up next to a deadly dungeon. He’s much stronger than he realizes.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: Imagine, un cambrousard du dernier donjon dans la ville de départ !
หนุ่มน้อยใสซื่อจากหมู่บ้านหน้าลาสท์ดันเจี้ยนมาเข้ากรุงแล้ว

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

name.native: アラン・トイン・リドカイン
スレオニン・トイン・リドカイン

node.description:
[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

name.native: ルーチェ・トゥインクル・ウィンク

node.description: Alternate names: Tenchuu Girls Date of birth: Dec 30, 2012 Website Associates in Arc Jewel. Appeared as trainees of Lovely★Doll (愛乙女★DOLL) on December 30, 2012. The unit name changed to Love☆Ken (らぶ☆けん) on December 24, 2013. The unit was separated into two: Love☆Ken Luce and Love☆Ken Stella on February 2, 2014, and they were Love☆Ken Luce. The unit name changed to Luce Twinkle Wink☆ on May 23, 2014. The unit was also Tenchuu Girls (天誅ガールズ) from Black Bullet with dancer Kanami Sawaguchi (Tenchuu Green) and Seiyuu Erika Kaiho (Tenchuu Black), and participated Animelo Summer Live 2015 -THE GATE- on August 29, 2015 as backdancers of fripSide. The unit major debut via NBC Universal Entertainment Japan with Koiiro♡Shikoukairo on November 25, 2015. Members: Usami Yukino (Twinkle Pink) - was Tenchuu Pink from Tenchuu Girls Saori Itayama (Twinkle Water Blue) - was Tenchuu Blue from Tenchuu Girls Kaho Higaki (Twinkle Lavender) - originally from C-ZONE, was Rusuban Pink from Rusuban Girls and Tenchuu Violet from Tenchuu Girls Saki Fukasawa (Twinkle Red) - originally from coro☆coro with Saki Fukasawa, was Tenchuu Red from Tenchuu Girls Megumi Nishikiori (Twinkle Yellow) - originally from Hydrangea, was Tenchuu Yellow from Tenchuu Girls (Source: MAL)

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.
Musical composer, widely known for his work in Air TV, Kanon, Clannad, Little Busters, and other Key pieces.

__[Website](http://sonodakentaro.com/)__ Birthplace: Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan Instrument(s): vocal, guitar, bass and drums __Sonoda Kentarou__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, singer and songwriter.

__[Website](http://sonodakentaro.com/)__ Birthplace: Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan Instrument(s): vocal, guitar, bass and drums __Sonoda Kentarou__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, singer and songwriter.

__[Artist Profile (Globe-Enterbrainz)](http://www.globe-eb.com/artists_detail.php?id=19)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/soflan_daichi)__

__Soflan Daichi__ is a Japanese lyricist.

__Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

Daman Mills is an American voice actor affiliated with FUNimation Entertainment. 

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Blade - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Lyney - Genshin Impact

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Suppose a Kid from the Last Dungeon Boonies moved to a starter town?
Episode 2 - Suppose a majestic lion showed up to the petting section of a zoo and dozed off?
Episode 3 - Suppose someone told you they’d do anything for you, which you appreciate but you know you should push back?
Episode 4 - Suppose the protagonist of a novel led the story to a grand finale?
Episode 5 - Suppose someone took flirtation advice on a magazine way too seriously?
Episode 6 - Suppose the obviously superior contestant wins, but the clearly inferior contestant also wins?
Episode 7 - Suppose it’s looking like you need to clean up the mess, and you kind of saw it coming?
Episode 8 - Suppose you were just pretending to be lovers, but somehow the pretense transforms into the real deal!
Episode 9 - Suppose you visited an early dungeon but encountered three final bosses?
Episode 10 - Suppose someone suggested taking a short trip to Neverland, or something impossible like that?
Episode 11 - Suppose the villain starts appearing on and off like the middle part of a movie?
Episode 12 - Suppose a kid from the last dungeon boonies got used to life in a starter town?
